Load spatial or raster data from local files or Postgres

elsar_load_data.Rd

Loads spatial (sf) or raster (SpatRaster) data from various sources:

  • Local files: Shapefiles, GeoPackages, GeoJSON, TIFFs, GRDs, NetCDF, etc.

  • PostGIS databases via direct query

Usage

elsar_load_data(
  file_name = NULL,
  file_path = NULL,
  file_lyr = NULL,
  file_type,
  wkt_filter = NULL,
  db_info = NULL,
  drop3d = TRUE,
  pg_connection = NULL,
  iso3_column = "iso3",
  iso3
)

Arguments

file_name

Character or vector. File name(s) with extension, or NULL to load all files of the type (e.g., all .shp files in folder).

file_path

Character. Path to the local folder or file. Required for local sources.

file_lyr

Character. Optional. Specific layer name within a multi-layer file (e.g., a layer in a GPKG or GDB).

file_type

Character. One of: "postgres", "shp", "gpkg", "geojson", "gdb", "tif", "tiff", "grd", "gri", "nc", "hdf".

wkt_filter

Character. Optional WKT geometry used to spatially filter the data (e.g., a bounding box).

db_info

Named list. Required for Postgres if pg_connection is not supplied. Must contain: host, dbname, port, user, password.

drop3d

Logical. Whether to drop Z or M dimensions (3D/4D) to keep only XY (2D). Default is TRUE.

pg_connection

Named list. Alternative to db_info, passed directly to RPostgres::dbConnect.

iso3_column

Character. Column name to filter by ISO3 country code. Default is "iso3".

iso3

Character. ISO3 code (e.g., "NPL") to filter the vector data.

Value

An sf object (for vector formats) or a terra::SpatRaster (for raster formats).

Details

Vector data can be automatically filtered by an ISO3 country code and/or a WKT geometry. For shapefiles and multi-layer files (e.g. GeoPackage or file geodatabases), this function merges multiple layers or files and ensures consistent column alignment.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Load a single GeoTIFF
load_raster <- elsar_load_data(
  "layer.tif",
  "/data",
  file_type = "tif"
  )

# Load and merge all shapefiles in a folder
merged_shps <- elsar_load_data(
  file_name = NULL,
  file_path = "/data/shapes",
  file_type = "shp"
  )

# Load and filter a PostGIS table
load_pg <- elsar_load_data(
  file_name = "boundaries",
  file_type = "postgres",
  pg_connection = list(
    host = "localhost", dbname = "gis", port = 5432, user = "user", password = "pass"
  ),
  iso3_column = "iso3cd",
  iso3 = "NPL"
)
} # }
